microstructpy.orders package

Submodules

microstructpy.orders.base module

Base order class.

class microstructpy.orders.base.Order(trader_id: int, volume: int)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a generic order.

This class serves as a base class for specific order types. It provides the basic structure for managing order status and volume.

Attributes:

trader_idint

The ID of the trader submitting the order.

volumeint

The volume of the order.

timeint or float

The timestamp of the order submission.

statusstr

The status of the order.

filledint

The volume of the order that has been filled.

Methods:

active_volume()

Calculate the volume of the order that has not yet been filled.

property active_volume

Calculate the volume of the order that has not yet been filled.

microstructpy.orders.limit module

Limit order class.

class microstructpy.orders.limit.LimitOrder(trader_id: int, volume: int, price: int)[source]

Bases: Order

Represents a limit order.

A limit order is an order to buy or sell a security at a specific price or better.

Attributes:

trader_idint

The ID of the trader submitting the order.

volumeint

The volume of the order.

priceint

The price at which the order is submitted.

microstructpy.orders.market module

Market order class.

class microstructpy.orders.market.MarketOrder(trader_id: int, volume)[source]

Bases: Order

Represents a market order.

A market order is an order to buy or sell a security at the best available price.

Attributes:

trader_idint

The ID of the trader submitting the order.

volumeint

The volume of the order.

pricefloat

The price at which the order is submitted - infinity for buy orders and negative infinity for sell orders.

Methods:

__repr__()

Return a string representation of the order.

Module contents

Order types definitions.
